name: Askar
subtitle: The Burning Wastes
description: A desert continent where Nightmare energy has crystallized into psionic glass formations and storm columns. Tribal lineages splintered into war-clans long ago; today the Crimson Wolves claim the dunes while Black Suns convoys strip relics and Lunaris shards from fallen caravans.

places.name: The Glass Citadel
places.description: A psionic fortress grown from nightmare-crystal; its walls hum with echoes of thoughts and battle chants. Rumored Guardian relay hidden beneath.

places.name: Crimson Dunes
places.description: Scarlet iron-sand desert where the Crimson Wolves undertake blood-oath trials at moonset.

places.name: The Howling Spires
places.description: Needle towers of resonant crystal that emit a ceaseless wail when high winds pass—navigational beacons and omens alike.

places.name: Scorchwind Bazaar
places.description: A traveling market that circles the wastes with storm seasons; Ontwell brokers trade DME canisters and contraband relics.

places.name: Salt-Fall Canyon
places.description: Wind-carved ravines ringed with salt cataracts where caravans vanish during white squalls.

places.name: The Furnace Road
places.description: The only semi-stable highway across the wastes; Black Suns levy brutal tolls.

name: Oris
subtitle: The Frozen Mines
description: A glacial archipelago carved into industrial pits and shafts. Watchtowers ration heat and food while Tremor Units drill the Deep Veins for DME. Rumors speak of test labs hidden in the pristine summit facility above the soot-stained camps.

places.name: The Watchtower
places.description: Administrative citadel that monitors quotas and metes out punishment. Sterile upper floors mask a research core.

places.name: Gate Four
places.description: Primary descent to the Deep Veins; tremor sirens and frost fog mark each shift change.

places.name: Deep Veins
places.description: A labyrinth of DME-rich strata where Nightmares occasionally bore through from below.

places.name: Refinery Block C
places.description: Converts raw crystal into canisters; frequent accidents hushed by security units.

places.name: Lower Grid
places.description: Squalid warrens where inmates nearing sentence end are ‘reassigned’ or disappear for trials.

places.name: Icebreaker Docks
places.description: Harbor for supply barges cutting through pack ice; smugglers pay Ontwell for manifests.

name: Mistveil
subtitle: The Hidden Shores
description: An isolated volcanic isle veiled by ash fog and magnetic storms. Beneath its collapsed caldera lie Architect-era vaults tied to Obsidian myths. The Guardians guard its charts; the Liberators would bleed the seas to reach it.

places.name: Obsidian Ruins
places.description: Cyclopean vaults etched with tri-color sigils of Light, Dark, and Grey.

places.name: Ashen Shores
places.description: Beaches dusted in black glass sand; wreckage of the exodus still litters the surf.

places.name: Collapsed Caldera
places.description: The crater heart of Mistveil—now a flooded maw where strange lights bloom beneath the waves.

places.name: Tide-Tomb Caves
places.description: Sea caves used by smugglers and refugees; murals tell of a moon that watched and wept.

places.name: Windward Watch
places.description: A derelict lighthouse converted into a Guardian signal post.

name: Duskar
subtitle: The Ember Coasts
description: A sprawling subcontinent of river deltas, dry forests, and copper ranges. The Liberators operate shipyards and academies here while rural communes barter with Ontwell factors. Coastal towns host public trials of Awakened duels—half festival, half fear.

places.name: Ironroot Shipyards
places.description: Liberator drydocks and retrofit slips; rumor says a submersible fitted to brave Mistveil shoals was built here.

places.name: Vel Mora Academy
places.description: School for field operatives and cryptography; recruits memorize fractured circle catechisms.

places.name: Trident Quay
places.description: Crowded port where Liberator agents mingle with Ontwell factors and pirate crews.

places.name: Rainscar Forest
places.description: A monsoon-bitten jungle scored by lightning burns that never quite heal.

places.name: The Copper Steppe
places.description: Wind-flattened grasslands over copper-bearing loam; caravan leagues race the duststorms.

name: Nerethis
subtitle: The Green Reach
description: A tall, fjord-bitten landmass of rainforests, misty highlands, and glacier-fed rivers. Ranger enclaves protect relic groves while isolated monasteries study moonlit rites. The Guardians keep quiet listening posts along the northern ridge.

places.name: Verdant Stair
places.description: A vast terrace of jungle plateaus and cloud gardens stepped toward the sea.

places.name: Moonwell Monastery
places.description: Ancient order preserving lunar rites; neutral ground for Awakened pilgrims.

places.name: Fjordline Ports
places.description: Chain of harbors tucked into knife-cut inlets; timber and fish caravans depart nightly.

places.name: Whisperspine
places.description: A ridgeline where leaves ‘speak’ in patterned rustles—believed to be lunar resonance.

places.name: Greywatch Ridge
places.description: Discreet Guardian survey station camouflaged among lichened stones.

name: Rusava
subtitle: The Broken Crown
description: A sprawling southern continent of deserts, badlands, and snow-bitten archipelagos. City-states feud over caravan routes and old empires’ bones. Ontwell Syndicate banks anchor the trade lattice from vaulted undercities.

places.name: Cinder Gate
places.description: Fortified caravan metropolis built into a volcanic saddle; every road pays the Gate.

places.name: Sunken Palatine
places.description: Collapsed imperial capital half-claimed by dunes; catacombs now house a ledger of debts.

places.name: Shard Wastes
places.description: Plain glittering with broken lunar glass—profitable, lethal, and fiercely contested.

places.name: Seven-Salt Archipelago
places.description: Chain of briny isles famous for storm pearls and ship-breaker reefs.

places.name: Ledgerhall (Ontwell)
places.description: Marble vault where Ontwell adjudicates black-market contracts and blood-bail bonds.

places.name: Pilgrim’s Causeway
places.description: Ancient road resurfaced by Awakened stonemasons; guarded by toll-priests in orange veils.

name: The Voidlands
subtitle: The Shattered Expanse
description: Zones where reality buckles—skies shear, gravity wobbles, and echoes of other places bleed through. Nomad orders track anomalies for salvage while Nightmare hunters cull emergent horrors.

places.name: Eventline Rift
places.description: A canyon where time ‘skips’ like a stone across water; teams tether themselves to return.

places.name: Mirror Salt Flats
places.description: Polished panes of mineralized salt reflecting skies that aren’t here.

places.name: The Unmoored Tower
places.description: A spire that appears at shifting coordinates; interior stairs run in impossible loops.

places.name: Nomad Camp K-3
places.description: Caravan enclave of anomaly trackers, glassblowers, and bone-map scriveners.

places.name: Anomaly Orchard
places.description: A grove of metallic trees that ‘fruit’ gravity wells after storms.

name: Wasteland Expanse
subtitle: Irradiated Badlands
description: A vast irradiated plateau of slag fields, crater lakes, and fused glass deserts left by forgotten tests. Mutant clades bargain with Black Suns scavengers; storms run green at the core.

places.name: Mutant Colonies
places.description: Settlements of altered survivors trading scavenged alloys and stormwater.

places.name: Energy Anomalies
places.description: Space-time eddies where instruments spin and voices arrive before their senders.

places.name: Crashed Research Station
places.description: A downed aerial lab; rumored Ontwell contracts pay for intact cores.

places.name: The Glass Desert
places.description: Miles of fused silica dunes that cut boots and distort horizon lines.

name: Industrial Zone 7
subtitle: Manufacturing Complex
description: An endless grid of automated fabs, chemical towers, and dorm-stacks. Shift whistles mark the city’s only music. Ontwell manifests run through every loading bay.

places.name: Factory Prime
places.description: Flagship automated line for advanced components; guarded by private security mechs.

places.name: Chemical Processing Plant
places.description: Refines precursor slurries; occasional violet fires leak into the canal.

places.name: Transit Spine
places.description: Magline that stitches dorm blocks to loading yards in five-minute pulses.

name: Neo-Tokyo Central
subtitle: Corporate Megacity
description: The Guardian-aligned world capital of steel, glass, and neon. Skyscraper stacks host executive enclaves while underlevels buzz with runners, scrappers, and Rob in Hood’s rumors.

places.name: Corporate Plaza
places.description: Decision core of the megacity; beneath it a Guardian signal array routes the planet’s secure traffic.

places.name: Data Center Alpha
places.description: Primary processing nexus handling surveillance, logistics, and civic credit ledgers.

places.name: Underground Markets
places.description: Tunnel sprawl where corporate rejects become rare goods; Ontwell buyers haggle in coded hand signs.

name: Neo-Tokyo Outskirts
subtitle: Abandoned Districts
description: Crumbling residential sectors evacuated after consolidation. Squatters and resistance cells share power grids patched from billboard lines.

places.name: Rebel Hideout
places.description: A buried tram depot converted into safehouses and a printing press for coded broadsheets.

places.name: Resistance Base
places.description: Operations center for cells targeting corporate relays—half clinic, half armory.
